headline: Easy Cheesy Tuna Noodle Casserole
description: A mixture of cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, and melted cheese coat egg noodles and tuna in this casserole topped with a layer of Parmesan cheese.
name: Easy Cheesy Tuna Noodle Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) package processed cheese food (such as Velveeta®), cut into cubes
3 (5 ounce) cans chunk light tuna in water, drained
2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed cream of celery soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook egg noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Drain noodles and return to the pot. Pour olive oil and salt over the drained noodles; stir.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Put processed cheese food cubes into a large, microwave-safe bowl. Heat in microwave, stirring every 30 seconds, until melted and smooth, 3 to 5 minutes; pour over noodles and add tuna, peas, celery soup, mushroom soup, and black pepper. Stir to coat noodles completely; pour into a large casserole dish. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the top of the noodle mixture to cover completely.
Bake in preheated oven until Parmesan cheese just begins to brown, 20 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Wonderful casserole! I made quiet a few changes. Didn't have any egg noodles so used Rotini. I added Dijon mustard, 1/2 cup of milk, sun dried tomatoes, roasted red peppers, canned mushrooms, onion powder, and garlic powder. Instead of putting cheese on the top, I used bread crumbs with melted butter. I know it sounds like a lot of changes! I've been very sick for 2 years and in a wheelchair. Cooking was the one thing I could do. Became fascinated with spice.
Great taste and easy to make I double the cheese

I did not like the taste of this recipe nor the texture. The other reviews were correct about this recipe making a LOT of tuna casserole. I think the recipe relies too much on the creamed soups and salt to provide flavor, and not enough on actually adding flavor with herbs and spices.

Use low sodium everything possible. Low sodium soup especially, since my wife is on a sodium restricted diet. Low sodium canned peas (frozen will work), low sodium noodles if possible. The recipe as is simply is overloaded with sodium. And be sure to rinse the tuna because it too contains a huge amount of salt.
Made it just like the recipe, minus the celery which I did not have on hand, awesome!

I did add milk because I remember we used to back in the olden days lol it’s great , I forgot to get peas at the store so no veggies , I missed them tho , they really add to it . We used to crunch up potato chips on top but it was so salty so I tried your Parm idea Perfect
The family loved it. Yes I did a few changes but it was really good.

I love making this dish! It is easy and every time i change something. This time I used cheddar cheese instead. I also added mixed vegetables and a can of cream of chicken along with the cream of mushroom. I’m disabled but I love to cook. This is a very easy to make
I added onion and celery for more flavor, changed the peas to corn. It was good.

I agree with the other critique, this was delish but way too dry! I meant to add the milk but totally forgot and definitely wished I had. The flavor is good. Family loves it. Super simple!!! Will definitely make again WITH milk

This recipe was delicious. The only reason I gave it a 4 rather than a 5 is because I added about 1/2 cup milk before I baked it because it seemed too thick. Other than that, the taste was delightful!

I accidentally left out 1 can of cream of celery. I used 16 oz of noodles. I had no parm, used cheddar instead. I have to say, it was a sooo salty. I will use no salt added peas and omit the salt. Under all that salt, it was pretty good!

I didn't make any changes, next time I make it I will cut the 
recipe in half. It makes a lot. Excellent.
I normally will make recipes as instructed but in this instance I am not a fan of velveeta cheese so I swapped that out for regular cheddar cheese.
